title: Current IATI aid activities in Turks and Caicos Islands

bites.bite: In Turks and Caicos Islands, EU is working in Education, level unspecified.

In Turks and Caicos Islands, there are European Commission - International Partnerships-EuropeAid and European Commission - Development and Cooperation-EuropeAid working in Education, level unspecified.
The largest activity_url is http://d-portal.org/q.html?aid=XI-IATI-EC_DEVCO-2017/385-070 with 1 reports followed by http://d-portal.org/q.html?aid=XI-IATI-EC_DEVCO-2018/399-805 with 1 reports.
The largest reporting is European Commission - International Partnerships-EuropeAid with 6 reports.

bites.title: Map of locations
bite: Communication and Visibility Activities for 11th EDF Turks and Caicos Islands  Education Sector Reform Contract -

The purposes of this contract are as follows:Purpose 1:To provide technical assistance to  develop a ten-year school infrastructure and equipment maintenance and modernisation plan for the Ministry of Education, Youth, Sports and Library Services (MoEYSLS); Purpose 2:To provide technical assistance with tenders for new schools and upgrade of existing schools as well as project supervision and monitoring reports;Purpose 3: To enhance TCI Government capacities in planning, programming a

Design and implementation of a Labour Market Information System (LMIS) survey. Feasibility study and implementation strategy for the establishment of a National Technical Vocational Training Centre and Agency. Capacity building to the MoEYSLS and TCI Community College in undertaking technical dialogue with private sector. Design, implement and monitor TVET teachers initial - continuous training programmes, in accordance to Caribbean Vocational Qualifications (CVQ) - Caribbean Association of Na

The main purpose of the 2019 PEFA assessment is to provide the Turks and Caicos Islands Government (TCIG) and its development partners with an objective up-to-date assessment on the performance of the public financial management systems based on the latest internationally recognized PEFA methodology. The European Union is the main grant donor in the country, providing TCIG with budget support funds amounting to EUR 14.6 million with the aim of improving its education system. The financing agreem
